文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_003_chunk1
证据片段: The low hydrogen uptake of Zr-2.5Nb is associated with the β-Zr phase that contains 20% Nb

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_003_chunk1
证据片段: The delayed hydrogen cracking velocity of Zr-2.5Nb cold-worked material increases due to irradiation and K_ID is reduced by radiation hardening

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_003_chunk1
证据片段: For Zircaloy, the hydriding rate is proportional to the corrosion rate and hydrogen absorption depends on the final heat treatment, integrated annealing parameter, tin level, Ni level, Cr Level, and Fe/Cr ratio

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_003_chunk1
证据片段: Zr-2.5Nb, an alloy that is stronger than Zircaloy-2, is used for the pressure tubes

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_003_chunk1
证据片段: The metallurgical condition of the Zr-2.5Nb tubes varies in different countries: cold worked and annealed (Russia); cold worked and stress relieved (Canada); and water quenched, cold worked, and aged (India and Japan)

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_003_chunk1
证据片段: In CANDU pressure tubes, there is an initial decrease in fracture toughness with fluence and then little further change; this correlates well with the dislocation density
额外性质: {"fracture_toughness": "initial decrease with fluence then stabilizes", "correlation": "with dislocation density"}

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_003_chunk1
证据片段: chlorine, which is an impurity element, reduces the fracture toughness if there is more than 1 ppm present in the material

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_003_chunk1
证据片段: The irradiation growth behavior of small specimens from CANDU pressure tubes is quite variable. A key parameter has been found to be the iron concentration; increasing iron from 500 to 2000 ppm reduces the growth by about half

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_003_chunk1
证据片段: Biaxial creep behavior was reported for Zr-2.5Nb tubes up to fluences of 7·10²⁵ n·m⁻², showing the effect of texture on diametral strain rates

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_003_chunk2
证据片段: Reducing chlorine, carbon, and phosphorous increases fracture toughness, and increasing the iron decreases growth

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_003_chunk3
证据片段: The in-pile tests in the PR loop at Halden indicate no acceleration of corrosion rate of Zircaloy-4 when the lithium level in coolant was increased at 4.5 ppm

文献ID: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_003_chunk3
证据片段: A comparison of the corrosion behavior of a defective rod and adjacent nondefective rod irradiated for two cycles in a PWR indicates a significantly higher corrosion rate in the defective rod
